thread.title: Mara Louw shaken after shooting outside her home
thread.title_full: Mara Louw shaken after shooting outside her home

title: Mara Louw shaken after shooting outside her home
text:
Two years on: 'He's left a massive Simba shaped hole in my life,' says Jonathan Boynton-Lee 
The incident occurred two weeks ago outside Mara's home in Mzimhlophe, Soweto. 
Speaking to Sowetan Mara described the ordeal as a scene out of a movie. Mara's daughter and her boyfriend, Mashele were sitting outside in his car when she heard gunshots. 
"In my mind I was like 'who is still playing with firecrackers this time?' But after the second and third shots, I realised that it was a gun," Mara told the paper. 
The former Idols SA judge added that she immediately panicked and started screaming for her daughter. Two years on: 'He's left a massive Simba shaped hole in my life,' says Jonathan Boynton-Lee 
"On my way to the gate I saw her come in. We checked on her boyfriend who was shot in the arm. He was bleeding profusely. I have never seen so much blood come out of a human being," Mara added. 
Mashele died in hospital two days after the incident. Share
